RelatedSentence: updated 8:08 p.m. A man was hit and killed by a train near the North Lafayette Street bridge in Shelby on Monday , according to Shelby Police Department .
As of 9:30 a.m. we had a pedestrian hit at the North Lafyette Street Bridge , Shelby Police Chief Jeff Ledford said .
As of 9:30 a.m. we had a pedestrian hit at the North Lafyette Street Bridge , Shelby Police Chief Jeff Ledford said .
A white male identified as James Phillip Bell , 51 , of Mooresboro , was hit by a CSX empty coal train headed west .
Police believe that the Bell was near the bridge when he was struck and then drug about 200 yards west with the train .
It is still early in the investigation , Ledford said .
We are still interviewing the few witnesses that we have .
We are still interviewing the few witnesses that we have .
North Washington and Lafyette streets from Seaboard to Grover streets were blocked several hours by the stopped train and emergency vehicles .
People need to remember not to walk on tracks and to be careful while crossing tracks , he added .

People need to remember not to walk on tracks and to be careful while crossing tracks , he added .
Police continue to investigate what happened to Bell .

A man was hit and killed by a train on Washington Street around 9:30 a.m. on Monday , according to Shelby Police .
